articles.headline: Electronic Flaws Did Not Cause Toyota Problems, U.S. Says
articles.snippet: Federal investigators found that mechanical defects that had already been addressed were the only known cause of the acceleration problem.
articles.abstract: Federal investigators found that mechanical defects that had already been addressed were the only known cause of the acceleration problem.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — After dissecting Toyota’s engine control software and bathing its microchips in every type of radiation engineers could think of, federal investigators found no evidence that the company’s cars are susceptible to sudden acceleration from electronic failures, the government said Tuesday.

articles.headline: A Divisive Indian Official Is Loved by Businesses
articles.snippet: Narendra Modi is credited with bringing wealth and investment to Gujarat, but critics see a self-promoter with links to Hindu-Muslim riots.
articles.abstract: Narendra Modi is credited with bringing wealth and investment to Gujarat, but critics see a self-promoter with links to Hindu-Muslim riots.
articles.lead_paragraph: GANDHINAGAR, India  In a soaring, unfinished conference hall in western India, thousands of businessmen and diplomats from around the world gathered recently for an investment meeting. They were there to pay homage to a politician for accomplishing something once thought almost impossible in India: making it easy to do business.

articles.headline: For Federal Programs, a Taste of Market Discipline
articles.snippet: Policy makers are looking at ways to bring more competition to government programs.
articles.abstract: Policy makers are looking at ways to bring more competition to government programs.

articles.headline: Plans Near for Freddie and Fannie
articles.snippet: The Obama administration plans to offer a range of options for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac without stating a preference.
articles.abstract: The Obama administration plans to offer a range of options for Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac without stating a preference.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON  The Obama administration and House Republicans are settling into a game of chicken over Fannie Mae and Freddie Mac, with each side daring the other to advance a plan for replacing the two housing finance companies.

articles.headline: Malpractice Bill Raises Issues About a Lawsuit
articles.snippet: A representative, and retired obstetrician, who wants to reduce medical malpractice awards was involved in a $500,000 malpractice settlement.
articles.abstract: A representative, and retired obstetrician, who wants to reduce medical malpractice awards was involved in a $500,000 malpractice settlement.
articles.lead_paragraph: The lawmaker and retired obstetrician sponsoring a Congressional bill to sharply cut medical malpractice awards was involved in a $500,000 settlement of a malpractice lawsuit. The action was brought by a pregnant woman who charged that inappropriate care caused the loss of her fetus and other complications.

articles.headline: Obama Plans to Rescue States With Debt Burdens
articles.snippet: States that have borrowed from the federal government to pay unemployment benefits would get a two-year breather before facing tax increases and loan payments.
articles.abstract: States that have borrowed from the federal government to pay unemployment benefits would get a two-year breather before facing tax increases and loan payments.
articles.lead_paragraph: President Obama is proposing to ride to the rescue of states that have borrowed billions of dollars from the federal government to continue paying unemployment benefits during the economic downturn. His plan would give the states a two-year breather before automatic tax increases would hit employers, and before states would have to start paying interest on the loans.
articles.byline: By Michael Cooper and Sheryl Gay Stolberg

articles.headline: A Mexican City’s Troubles Reshape Its Families
articles.snippet: Drug violence and recession in Ciudad Juárez have changed the city’s character and demographics, leaving more multigenerational families led by women.
articles.abstract: Drug violence and recession in Ciudad Juárez have changed the city’s character and demographics, leaving more multigenerational families led by women.
articles.lead_paragraph: CIUDAD JUÁREZ, Mexico — Telma Pedro Córdoba could have left this blood- and bullet-marked city when she lost her husband to a drive-by shooting in 2009, or when an injury kept her mother from factory work, or when gunmen killed a neighbor in front of a friend’s 3-year-old son a few months ago.

articles.headline: In Tokyo, a Crackdown on Sexual Images of Minors
articles.snippet: Japanese publishers and fans are objecting to newly tightened restrictions on sales of explicit manga comics in Tokyo.
articles.abstract: Japanese publishers and fans are objecting to newly tightened restrictions on sales of explicit manga comics in Tokyo.
articles.lead_paragraph: TOKYO  In a manga comic book that is well known here, “My Wife Is an Elementary School Student,” a 24-year-old teacher marries a 12-year-old girl as part of a top-secret social experiment.
